intro: Wendlandia paniculata, commonly known as the panicle bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in temperate climates.
